revised_title: The Royal Society's Antarctic Expedition Honored by Queen Elizabeth
tldr: In 1956, Queen Elizabeth honored the Royal Society's International Geophysical Year Antarctic Expedition during a visit to the Motor Ship Magga Dan. The event celebrated the scientific contributions of the expedition and its members, who were about to embark on their journey to Royal Society Base, Halley Bay. The M.S. Magga Dan and M.V. Tottan sailed from London to Antarctica, carrying essential supplies and personnel for the expedition.
